Hi Frank, Thanks for sharing the comparisons, and Yes I think the copper bo=
x sounds left muffeled and clearer than the steel box.
LK



----- Original=
 Message ----
From: Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@...>
To: Group <ev=
p-itc@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, April 29, 2008 12:49:33 AM
Subject: [=
EVP-ITC] The copper vs steel box.


=A0I wanted to compare the two boxes, I=
 just finished a galvanized steel box, that scrap metal I get from work. I =
did the same as the copper box, try to select the best sounding speaker for=
 it. The use it with #33. I like the steel box better, I think last night, =
the clearer voices had more to do with conditions thant he equipment. Or--c=
ould it be the other way around, tonights conditions are poor for either bo=
x? It gets frustrating cuz ya can't nail the damn stuff down, it seems to d=
efy any attempts at definition. 
=A0
=A0I know, there was at least one pers=
on scrambling to make a copper box, that's why I wanted more testing. I wis=
h I could give some difinitive answers, but there just=A0doens't seem to be=
 any.
=A0
=A0Then, get a voice that seems to be Raudive, I would expect som=
e signifgiant difference with the copper box, I'm not hearing any thing any=
 better. 
=A0
=A0BTW, the mp3s are in my folder. 
=A0
=A0Frank-S
=A0
=A0

<P> I wanted to compare the two boxes, I just finished a galva=

pper box, try to select the best sounding speaker for it. The use it with #=
33. I like the steel box better, I think last night, the clearer voices had=
 more to do with conditions thant he equipment. Or--could it be the other w=
ay around, tonights conditions are poor for either box? It gets frustrating=
 cuz ya can't nail the damn stuff down, it seems to defy any attempts at de=
finition. <BR> <BR> I know, there was at least one person scrambl=
ing to make a copper box, that's why I wanted more testing. I wish I could =

t some signifgiant difference with the copper box, I'm not hearing any thin=
